notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform release 4.3.5 is now available with
updates to packages and images that fix several bugs.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for Red Hat OpenShift Container
Platform 4.3.5. See the following advisory for the container images for
this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0676

All OpenShift Container Platform 4.3 users are advised to upgrade to these
updated packages and images.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.3.5 packages update

notes.text: A flaw was found in Jenkins. Encryption key parameters are improperly reused in the Inbound TCP Agent Protocol/3 allowing unauthorized attackers with knowledge of agent names to obtain the connection secrets for those agents. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: Inbound TCP Agent Protocol/3 authentication bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, ensure all previously released errata relevant
to your system have been applied.

For OpenShift Container Platform 4.3 see the following documentation, which
will be updated shortly for release 4.3.5, for important instructions on
how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata
update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.3/release_notes/ocp-4-3-release-notes.html

Details on how to access this content are available at
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.3/updating/updating-cluster-cli.html.

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins: Inbound TCP Agent Protocol/3 authentication bypass

notes.text: Jenkins 2.218 and earlier, LTS 2.204.1 and earlier was vulnerable to a UDP amplification reflection denial of service attack on port 33848.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: UDP multicast/broadcast service amplification reflection attack
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins: UDP multicast/broadcast service amplification reflection attack

notes.text: Jenkins 2.218 and earlier, LTS 2.204.1 and earlier did not use a constant-time comparison function for validating connection secrets, which could potentially allow an attacker to use a timing attack to obtain this secret.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: Non-constant time comparison of inbound TCP agent connection secret
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: Jenkins 2.218 and earlier, LTS 2.204.1 and earlier used a non-constant time comparison function when validating an HMAC.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: Non-constant time HMAC comparison
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: Jenkins 2.218 and earlier, LTS 2.204.1 and earlier exposed session identifiers on a user's detail object in the whoAmI diagnostic page.

notes.text: Jenkins 2.218 and earlier, LTS 2.204.1 and earlier allowed users with Overall/Read access to view a JVM memory usage chart.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: Memory usage graphs accessible to anyone with Overall/Read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: REST API endpoints in Jenkins 2.218 and earlier, LTS 2.204.1 and earlier were vulnerable to clickjacking attacks.
